intro: Azara fernandeziana, commonly known as the Cuban azara, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Cuba. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, preferring well-drained soil. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
